com.tuxnet.utils

Class H2

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tuxnet.utils.H2

  • public class H2
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for interaction with H2 database.

    References:
    1) https://www.tutorialspoint.com/h2_database/h2_database_jdbc_connection.htm
    2) http://www.h2database.com/html/tutorial.html#creating_new_databases

      • H2

          java.lang.String username,

        H2 constructor.
        Parameters:
        h2DBPath - path to H2 database
        username - valid username to given H2 database
        password - username's password

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect(boolean checkIfExists,
                    boolean verbose)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Connects to the database. By default, if the database specified in the URL does not yet exist, a new (empty) database is created automatically.
        Parameters:
        checkIfExists - if true: before connecting to database method which checks existence of database will be called
        verbose - if true - gives output to stdout
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - ClassNotFoundException: when driver declared in JDBC_DRIVER doesn't exist
        SQLException: when connection to H2 database failed

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(boolean verbose)
        Disconnects from H2 database
        Parameters:
        verbose - if true - gives output to stdout

      • select

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> select(java.lang.String sqlStatement,
                                                               java.util.List<java.lang.String> columns,
                                                               boolean verbose)
                                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Run SELECT SQL statement
        Parameters:
        sqlStatement - SQL statement which will be sent to the database
        columns - retrieved columns from SQL query response
        verbose - if true - gives sqlStatement to stdout
        Returns:
        the SQL query response
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - SQLException if an SQL error occurs
